main event: A luminous object was sighted in the sky over Colorado Springs, Colorado on December 17, 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared to be like a comet streak with a reddish front, tapering toward the rear with sparks.
The object was bluish-white in color and about the size of a pea.
The sighting lasted for only 3 seconds.
The object appeared to slow down, change direction, and then descend quickly towards Pikes Peak before disappearing.
witnesses: HQ USAF personnel, 2LT William T. Niven (Assistant Chief, Support Division, ADCOI, and Intelligence)
